item.title: Coronavirus Hits Peru Hard Despite Strict Lockdown
item.description: Peru implemented one of the Western Hemisphere’s strictest lockdowns to slow the coronavirus pandemic. But the country is now grappling with Latin America’s worst outbreak outside of Brazil.

item.title: Governments May Revisit Postwar Playbook as They Tackle Huge Debts
item.description: In the U.S. and elsewhere, government debt is set to soar this year. Some people thinking about how to pay down the debt are looking at an approach used after World War II: financial repression.

item.title: Beijing Coronavirus Outbreak Tied to Market Sparks Fear of Resurgence
item.description: Chinese health authorities shut down parts of Beijing and adopted tight controls after the capital confirmed a record number of new Covid-19 infections, sparking growing concerns about a coronavirus resurgence.

item.title: At Florence's Uffizi Galleries, Fewer Visitors Make for a Better Visit
item.description: Social-distancing rules and greatly reduced tourism are giving those who manage to visit one of the most popular museums in Italy and the world more time to see Renaissance masterpieces.

item.title: China a Bright Spot for U.S. in Global Trade
item.description: China has retaken its mantle as America’s largest trading partner, emerging as a rare bright spot for U.S. farmers and other exporters as the pandemic limits global commerce.
